Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List: He was knowledgeable and calm and helped people to do the best they could.

She was a phenomenal group leader and facilitator. She authentically engaged in dialogue with each and every person in our group. Likewise she challenged us in our thinking and learning experience. I am grateful to have had her as our practicum instructor.
Brenda offered feedback very clearly and gently, and was open to answering questions from the group at any time. I appreciated her time and guidance.
He took the time, outside of the assignment, to sit with students and discuss anything they were struggling with.
She gave really helpful feedback on the roleplays- I appreciated getting both praise and critiques that were constructive.

Strengths:
Flexibility
Open Mindedness
Encouraging attitude
Provides valuable and meaningful feedback to role-plays
Willing to stick with boundaries

Rev. McCaw did a great job supporting the group during the role play, offering insights from his own experience.  The relaxed pace of the sessions was good for reflection, though perhaps at the expense of people having more time to actually role play.
Willis McCaw guided our role plays with dignity, insight and good humor. A classic experience of learning from our mistakes, assisted by his gentle yet welcome direction as we moved along.
